definitions.definition: say or write something to deal with or as a reaction to someone or something.
provide the required responses to (a test or quiz).
examples: answer the questions below for a chance to win a vacation

definitions.definition: respond impudently or disrespectfully to someone, especially when being criticized or told to do something.
examples: one couldn't argue with a parent; one couldn't answer back

definitions.definition: act in reaction to (a sound such as a telephone ringing or a knock or ring on a door).

examples: I answer to the assistant commissioner
synonyms: be responsible to "I answer to the commissioner"

definitions.definition: defend oneself against (a charge, accusation, or criticism).
examples: he said he would return to Spain to answer all charges
synonyms: defend oneself against "she has yet to answer the charges"

definitions.definition: be required to explain or justify oneself to (someone).
examples: you will have the police to answer to

definitions.definition: be responsible or to blame for.
examples: the dust mite has a lot to answer for, especially if you are asthmatic
synonyms: atone "he will answer for his crime"be accountable
take the blame; informaltake the rap "the government has a lot to answer for"

definitions.definition: be suitable for fulfilling (a need); satisfy.
examples: entrepreneurship is necessary to answer the needs of national and international markets
synonyms: measure up to "we're trying to answer the needs of our audience"
